meanings.definition: The raised part at the back of a saddle.
meanings.sent1: The cantles of the saddle provide support for the rider.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the cantles of the saddle before mounting the horse.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to balance on the cantles of the saddle for fun.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the valley, bouncing off the cantles of the saddle.
meanings.sent5: The sun gleamed on the polished cantles, making them shine like silver.

meanings.definition: A corner or edge of something, especially a piece of land.
meanings.sent1: The house was nestled in the cantles of the valley, surrounded by nature.
meanings.sent2: He surveyed the cantles of the field, planning where to build the fence.
meanings.sent3: The cat loved to hide in the cantles of the garden, waiting to pounce on unsuspecting birds.
meanings.sent4: The shadows lengthened, creeping into the cantles of the meadow as evening approached.
meanings.sent5: The old tree stood tall at the cantles of the forest, a silent guardian of the woods.

meanings.definition: To divide into sections or parts.
meanings.sent1: She carefully cantles the cake into equal slices for the party.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter will cantle the wood to create the intricate design.
meanings.sent3: The teacher asked the students to cantle the story into beginning, middle, and end.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to cantle the landscape, splitting it into two distinct halves.
meanings.sent5: His words seemed to cantle the room, creating an awkward silence among the guests.
